metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10132 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in libvirt >= 4.1.0 in the virtlockd-admin.socketand virtlogd-admin.socket systemd units. A missing SocketMode configurationparameter allows any user on the host to connect using virtlockd-admin-sockor virtlogd-admin-sock and perform administrative tasks against thevirtlockd and virtlogd daemons.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-bin - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-clients - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-daemon - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-sheepdog - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-daemon-system - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-sanlock - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt-wireshark - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
libvirt0 - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvirt package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-1ubuntu8.9').
